description.narrative: Att stödja Liberias utvecklingskonferens, Liberia Development Conference, den 1-2 februari 2017, samt att även finansiera en publicering av konferens antologi i april/maj 2017 utgör det svenska bidraget till konferensen liksom dess uppföljning. På grund av fördröjning i slutförandet av redigeringen av konferenshandlingarna kommer dock utskrift av konferensantologin att ske i oktober 2017. Ambassaden, USAID och University of Liberia höll gemensamt i konferensen, och kommer tillsammans att ge stöd till spridningen av lärdomar från konferensen. Konferensen samlade flera olika aktörer och beslutsfattare från den liberianska biståndsarenan för att identifiera och diskutera de utmaningar och möjligheter som hållbar utveckling innebär för Liberia. Liberia Development Conference hade som syfte att utnyttja de kommande liberianska presidentvalen för att sprida information kring de främsta utmaningarna liksom lösningar på Liberias komplexa utvecklingsproblem. Ambassaden anser att partnerskapet med University of Liberia är högst relevant, då den akademiska institutionen fyller en viktig roll i att tillföra evidensbaserat och analytiskt tänkande i frågor kring Liberias utvecklingsutmaningar och lösningar. Slutsatser och funderingar kring Liberias huvudsakliga utvecklingsdiskurs, dragna av de olika aktörer som deltog på konferensen, kan göra stor nytta om de dokumenteras, presenteras samt följs upp väl. Ambassaden anser att publiceringen av konferensantologin är ett steg på vägen för att uppnå detta mål. Offentliggörandet av antologin kommer innefatta en enklare sammanfattad version om ca 105 sidor, liksom en fullständig sammanställning på ca 571 sidor.

To co-sponsor Liberia Development Conference 1-2 February 2017 and to specifically finance the aspect relating to the publication of the conference anthology in April/May 2017 is part of the Swedish contribution to the conference and its follow up. Due to delay in the editing of the conference papers, the printing of the Anthology is expected to occur in October 2017. The Embassy of Sweden in collaboration with USAID and the University of Liberia have co-hosted a conference and will support the dissemination of the learning outcome from the conference. The conference brought together practitioners, policymakers, and change agents from the Liberian development arena to identify and discuss those challenges and options on the way forward for sustainable development in Liberia. The Liberia Development Conference aims at taking advantage of the upcoming elections in 2017 to disseminate information about the key problems and potential solutions to Liberia's complex development challenges. The Embassy of Sweden assess the partnership with the University of Liberia as highly relevant and important, as the academic institution fulfilled an important role in bringing evidence based thinking and analyses to the key questions of Liberia's main development challenges and solutions. The Embassy recognises that the thinking and conclusions made by academia, practitioners, policy makers and other important stakeholders to Liberia's main development discourse can have greater benefit for wider use if they are documented, presented and followed up properly. The publication of the anthology of the conference papers is by the Embassy seen as an important step towards this objective. The publication of the conference papers will include a simplified version of 80 pages and the main version of the compilation of all the papers of 400 pages. Following the conclusion of the final editing of the various conference papers the main Anthology comprises of 571 pages and the simplified version comprises 105 pages.

description.narrative: Brief Background Menekemu Design and Packaging was contracted by the Embassy to print the conference papers from the Liberia Development Conference convened by the USAID, Embassy of Sweden in collaboration with the University of Liberia Feb 1-2, 2017. The objective of the Conference was to bring together pratitioners, policy makers, civil society and change agents from the Liberia development arena to identify and discuss challenges and propose solutions. The Anthology was aimed at widely sharing the policy debates that arose from the analytical papers with a broad range of stakeholders. As part of the division of labour in the collaboration for the conference, the Embassy covered the cost of the printing of the conference papers into Full Anthology (571 pages) and a Simplified Anthology (105 pages). USAID through the Liberia Strategic Analysis (LSA) has the responsibility to fund various learning events in collaboration with the University of Liberia for the dissemination of the printed Anthology. Main results delivered based on the contract 1. Printed and delivered 1000 copies of the main conference anthology - total of 571 pages, hardback on acid free paper. The delivery exceeded the initial requirement which was paperbound. Menekemu Design and Packaging recommended hardback without additional cost to the Embassy as they concluded that a hardback would be more durable. 2. Printed and delivered 1000 copies of the simplified conference anthology - total 105 pages, paperbound on acid free papers.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
